boone.util

Class RootSolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • boone.util.RootSolver

  • public class RootSolver
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains methods to find roots and limits of functions. Some methods are only reliable for functions that describe the form of emitted, or the effect of received spikes, in the context of the simulation of spiking neural networks.

    Version:
    $Id: RootSolver.java 2239 2014-11-15 jmory $
    Author:
    Johannes Mory

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double calcLimit(Function f, int type, double limit)
      Calculates the point at which the specified function will fall below a given bound.
      double findRoot(Function f, double start, double end)
      Searches for the first root r inside the specified interval such that f'(r) >= 0.

      • RootSolver

        public RootSolver()

    • Method Detail

      • findRoot

        public double findRoot(Function f,
                       double start,
                       double end)
        Searches for the first root r inside the specified interval such that f'(r) >= 0.
        Parameters:
        f - the function to search
        start - the lower bound of the search interval
        end - the upper bound of the search interval
        Returns:
        the first root with f'(r) >= 0 if found, else Double.NaN

      • calcLimit

        public double calcLimit(Function f,
                        int type,
                        double limit)
        Calculates the point at which the specified function will fall below a given bound. This method is only reliable for functions that describe the form of emitted, or the effect of received spikes, in the context of the simulation of spiking neural networks. If the specified type is not supported a NotImplemented exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        f - a function that describes the form of an emitted, or models the effect of a received spike
        type - either SpikeEvent.PRE_SPIKE, or SpikeEvent.POST_SPIKE
        limit - the value of the bound
        Returns:
        the point at which the function value falls below the specified bound
